preqs: Twelve credit points of second-year Arts units. As this is a third-year level unit, it is highly recommended that students only take this unit after they have completed two second-year level units in Journalism or Journalism practice.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ACL2%, AEH2%, AMU2%, ASA2%, ATS2%, AZA2%} or  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ACL2005, ACL299%, AEH299%, AMU299%, ASA2331, ASA299%, ATS2208, ATS2296, ATS2297, ATS2344, ATS2386, ATS2387, ATS2394, ATS2612, ATS2713, ATS2957, ATS299%, AZA2423, AZA299%, MON2003})

For COURSE_CODE IN {A6008, A6011} Do true Otherwise (Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ACL2%, AEH2%, AMU2%, ASA2%, ATS2%, AZA2%} or  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ACL2005, ACL299%, AEH299%, AMU299%, ASA2331, ASA299%, ATS2208, ATS2296, ATS2297, ATS2344, ATS2386, ATS2387, ATS2394, ATS2612, ATS2713, ATS2957, ATS299%, AZA2423, AZA299%, MON2003})

description: This unit explores the research and journalism practices associated with Reporting the Arts Circuit across film, literature, visual and performing arts. Students will learn how to canvass contemporary issues and case studies with key personalities and institutions. Students will also critically consider the professional and social implications of reporting the arts circuit. Please be aware that access to certain technology/equipment may be required for this unit. Contact the unit coordinator for details. The successful reportage will be showcased on Monash's journalism website, Mojo, or published on lifestyle websites.
